references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces NeRF, a foundational work in neural radiance fields that heavily influenced the development of 3D Gaussian splatting and other novel view synthesis methods.

references.paper_title: Mip-NeRF: A multiscale representation for anti-aliasing neural radiance fields
references.reason: Mip-NeRF significantly improved the quality and efficiency of NeRF rendering, addressing limitations in original NeRF's performance, which is relevant to the 3D Gaussian splatting technique.

references.paper_title: Plenoxels: Radiance fields without neural networks
references.reason: Plenoxels offered a significant advancement by achieving high-quality rendering without relying on neural networks, an approach that contrasts and complements 3D Gaussian splatting.

references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper introduced 3D Gaussian splatting, the core method the current work builds upon; it is the most directly relevant foundational paper.

references.paper_title: Mini-splatting: Representing scenes with a constrained number of gaussians
references.reason: Mini-splatting directly addresses the efficiency challenges of 3D Gaussian splatting that the current work aims to improve, making it a crucial comparative method.
